poem:
**Diplomacy at Play**

In corridors of tense  
whispers, UK and France  
stitch torn threads;  
a needle's dance between  
silk and sinew—delicate  
art on precarious tracks.  
Whiplash winds could  
fray resolve, unraveling  
common cords, despite  
the fragile weave—  
Gossamer, taut.  
Amid the fragile  
alchemy, trust flickers.   
Balance waits, watching.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Art of a deal: how UK and France led dogged effort to repair US-Ukraine ties – for now The 11 days of whiplash-inducing diplomacy British and French officials endured to repair shattered relations between Washington and Kyiv, and for the first time put Donald Trump’s trust in Vladimir Putin to the test, could go down as one of the great feats of diplomatic escapology. The dogged fence-mending may yet unravel as multiple hurdles remain, principally". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
